title: Publications

Graf, D. R. M., Moser, M. K., Gandhi, S., Badici, M. & Resch, B. (2025). A multimodal approach combining wearable sensors and point of view videos to evaluate stress in urban cycling. ACM Transactions on Spatial Algorithms and Systems. [pdf]

Understanding the influence of urban characteristics on cyclists’ stress measured through wearable sensors: A quantitative open data approach. Environment and Planning B: Urban Analytics and City Science, 0(0). [pdf]

title: David R.M. Graf
text:
Lab
  
  
    
     Web
  
  
    
     Mail
  
  
     
  
  
    
     
  

  
  



My name is David Ruben Max Graf, I am a PhD Researcher at GEOMAR Helmholtz Centre for Ocean Research Kiel and Kiel University.
My research focuses on understanding the movement of fish, and how it may change in a changing climate. I use inverse reinforcement learning to learn the reward functions that govern fish behavior, and use those to virtually transport fish into the climate of 2050 or 2100.
I have the privilege of being supervised by Dr. Christopher Monk in the Marine Behavioural Ecology Group and Prof. Sören Christensen in the Mathematical Seminar at CAU Kiel.



I hold two Master’s degrees, in Data Science from Salzburg University (2025) and in Applied Limnology from BOKU University, Vienna (2022).
I have worked and published with researchers from both institutions. During my final year in Salzburg, I was affiliated with the working group Geosocial Artificial Intelligence and moved to the Interdisciplinary Transformation University Austria with them. In Vienna, I conducted my thesis research within the working group Integrative Modelling and Management of Aquatic Ecosystems.
